Our experience with the fuzzing stuff says that automatic bug creation WHEN
PAIRED WITH automatic bug closing works really well. Could we consider
doing that here too? (flake not seen in XX days, close)

On Thu, Nov 2, 2017 at 8:51 AM Jan Tattermusch <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@jtattermusch* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In tools/flakes/detect_flakes.py
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/13226#discussion_r148575413>:
>
> > +  logging.info('|reporting_results (%s, %s]| = %d',
> +               dates['reporting']['begin'].isoformat(),
> +               dates['reporting']['end'].isoformat(),
> +               len(reporting_names))
> +
> +  new_flakes = reporting_names - calibration_names
> +  logging.info('|new_flakes| = %d', len(new_flakes))
> +  return {k: reporting_results[k] for k in new_flakes}
> +
> +
> +def build_args_parser():
> +  import argparse, datetime
> +  parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
> +  today = datetime.date.today()
> +  a_week_ago = today - datetime.timedelta(days=7)
> +  parser.add_argument('--calibration_days', type=int, default=7,
>
> is it based on today's date or now() - 24hours. Also, is it "today" in
> pacific time, UTC or my local time?
